definition: to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl

sentences.english: Most of the crime is petty theft such as pick pocketing and purse snatching.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的犯罪都是小竊盜案件，如扒竊或偷竊錢包。

sentences.english: How to be on guard against pickpockets and swindlers?
sentences.chinese: 乘坐地鐵時如何防範扒竊和詐騙行爲？

sentences.english: The prevention and control of pick-pocketing is a social system project.
sentences.chinese: 扒竊行爲的防控是一項社會系統工程。

sentences.english: He likes to put his hand inside your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡扒竊別人口袋裏的東西。

sentences.english: Pickpockets face stepped-up surveillance in most public places.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數公共場合，對扒竊的監視越來越嚴格。

sentences.english: Pickpockets, the most popular crimes of all, are everywhere in every country.
sentences.chinese: 最流行的犯罪，扒竊，存在於任何國家的任何地方。

sentences.english: Snatching , pickpocketing , and shop thefts all rose.
sentences.chinese: 搶掠扒竊及店鋪盜竊均有所增加。
他們起訴他扒竊商店貨物。

sentences.english: The storekeeper signed a complaint accusing them of shoplifting.
sentences.chinese: 店東簽定了控訴書，指控他們在店裏扒竊貨色。

sentences.english: The widespread use of debit cards hasn't helped, either.
sentences.chinese: 借記卡的廣泛應用，也促使了扒竊的消失。

definition: (of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to bring to justice/to punish according to the law
